title: NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance 2026
summary: The Space Shuttle Challenger Memorial is seen during a wreath laying ceremony that was part of NASAâ€™s Day of Remembrance, Thursday, Jan. 22, 2026, at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Va. Wreaths were laid in memory of those men and women who lost their lives in the quest for space exploratâ€¦
body: NASA/Keegan Barber The Space Shuttle Challenger Memorial is seen during a wreath laying ceremony that was part of NASA’s Day of Remembrance, Thursday, Jan. 22, 2026, at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Va. Wreaths were laid in memory of those men and women who lost their lives in the quest for space exploration. Each January, NASA pauses to honor members of the NASA family who lost their lives while furthering the cause of exploration and discovery, including the crews of Apollo 1 and space shuttles Challenger and Columbia. We celebrate their lives, their bravery, and contributions to human spaceflight. Image credit: NASA/Keegan Barber

title: Harry Styles Together, Together 2026 Tour Features a 30-Night Residency at MSG: Shop TicketsÂ Here
summary: Styles is back and ready to boogie with fans once more with this new tour in support of his upcoming solo album Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Harry Styles is going back on tour in 2026 with all new music. The newly announced tour, called Together, Together, features 50 dates in a total of seven cities with Styles visiting Europe, North America, Latin America and Australia. The tour is in support of the British artist’s upcoming fourth solo LP, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally , due for release on Mar. 6 via Columbia. The first show kicks off in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on May 16 and is slated to conclude in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 13. The first stop in America is in New York on Aug. 26 at Madison Square Garden and will end in the same place, Madison Square Garden, on Oct. 31. That’s a 30-night stint at the iconic New York venue, giving American audiences plenty of time to see the star before he heads to Melbourne. A slew of big names will be making appearances on Styles’ tour, including Robyn, Shania Twain , Fcukers, Jamie xx, Jorja Smith, Fousheé, Skye Neâ€¦

title: Watch Ben Stiller Bicker With â€˜Little Brotherâ€™ Benson Boone in Hilarious â€™70s-Themed Super BowlÂ Ads
summary: The unexpected duo have teamed up with Instacart ahead of this year's Big Game.
body: Benson Boone and Ben Stiller have teamed up with Instacart — the easy stop for moonbeam ice cream and any other treats you might need delivered to your door — ahead of this year’s Super Bowl. In two teaser clips posted Thursday (Jan. 22) previewing the delivery service’s Big Game campaign, the unexpected duo portray a European sibling musical duo with thick accents and even thicker shoulder pads on their shiny, green, ’70s-inspired stage outfits. In both videos, they hilariously bicker, starting with a fight over Boone’s pitchy harmony during an a cappella song about Instacart. title: Iâ€™m With Her Wins 2 Awards at 2026 International Folk Music Awards. Will a Grammy Win Follow on Feb.Â 1?
summary: Crys Matthews won song of the year for â€œSleeves Up.â€
body: Iâ€™m With Herâ€™s sophomore album, Wild and Clear and Blue , won album of the year at the 2026 International Folk Music Awards, which were presented on Wednesday (Jan. 21) in New Orleans. The awards were held on opening night of the Folk Alliance Internationalâ€™s 38th annual conference. Related Indigo Girls, Crys Matthews & More Win 2025 International Folk Music Awards: Full Winners List Sierra Ferrell, I’m With Her & More Lead Americana Honors & Awards Winners Grammy Nominations 2026: See the Complete List Iâ€™m With Herâ€™s album, produced by Josh Kaufman, is also nominated for best folk album at the 68th annual Grammy Awards, which will be presented on Feb. 1. “Ancient Light,” a track from the album, is also Grammy-nominated for best American roots performance and best American roots song. Iâ€™m With Her, a trio consisting of Sara Watkins, Sarah Jarosz and Aoife Oâ€™Donovan, also won artist of the year at the International Folk Music Awards, in a tie with Carsie Blanton . Iâ€™m With Her previously won in that category in 2018. They are the first repeat winners in the history of the category. Jarosz won album of the year as a solo artist in 2016 wiâ€¦

summary: Rocky gives Dominican dembow a spin.
body: A$AP Rocky surprised fans with a gift on Wednesday (Jan. 21), teaming up with Tokischa for “FLACKITO JODYE,” which finds the Harlem rapper heading uptown to try his hand at Dominican dembow. The bonus track appears to be part of the disc 2 Rocky has been teasing as a Don’t Be Dumb deluxe of sorts that’s on the way. “DISC 1 WAS FOR ME , DISC 2 WILL BE FOR THE FANS,” Rocky promised on Wednesday. DISC 1 WAS FOR ME , DISC 2 WILL BE FOR THE FANS!ğŸ”¥ #DONTBEDUMB — LORD FLACKO JODYE II (@asvpxrocky) January 21, 2026 According to Complex , Tokischa and Rocky shot the visual for “FLACKITO JODYE” a year ago, but a leak online derailed the track from receiving a proper release. The duo injects a dose of NYC swagger to the thumping bassline, which is sure to make listeners’ shoulders bop. “Harlem World like Mason Betha/ Dembow/ I’m a real New Yorker to the Timbo’/ But it really ain’t a hood that I can’t go,” Rocky raps before weaving in some Spanish and repeating the track’s title on the catchy chorus. The Dominican rapper feels right at home taking turns with Rocky, as she delivers a vulgar vâ€¦

He’s followed closely by J Balvin, who has 15 videos that have reached the milestone. Directed by Skillz in New York City and released summer 2022, “TitÃ­ Me PreguntÃ³” joins an elite list that also includes “DÃ¡kiti” with Jhay Cortez; “Amorfoda”; the Tainy-assisted “CallaÃ­ta”; “Me Porto Bonito” with Chencho Corleone; and his collab with Grupo Frontera “Un X100to.” The artist born Benito Antonio MartÃ­nez Ocasio has catapulted to global success with albums YHLQMDLG, Las Que No Iban a Salir, El Ãšltimo Tour del Mundo , Un Verano Sin Ti , Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar MaÃ±ana and, most recently, DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos . title: Herbie Hancock, Jacob Collier, Dee Dee Bridgewater & More to Celebrate International Jazz Day 2026 in Chicago: Its â€˜Vibrant Jazz Legacy RunsÂ Deepâ€™
summary: Featuring the traditional All-Star Global Concert, event is marking its 15th anniversary.
body: Chicago has been chosen as the global host city for International Jazz Day 2026. In tandem with the eventâ€™s 15th anniversary, a mix of concerts, educational programs and community events will be staged throughout the Windy City from April 1 to May 2. In keeping with tradition, the annual event will include an All-Star Global Concert. Set for April 30, the concert will be broadcast live globally from the Lyric Opera of Chicago. Led by musical director John Beasley, more than 40 artists will perform. The lineup includes Terence Blanchard, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Jacob Collier, BÃ©la Fleck, RenÃ©e Fleming, Robert Glasper, Gregory Porter, Lizz Wright and Jahari Stampley. Hancock and fellow Chicagoan Kurt Elling will serve as co-artistic directors of the concert with additional artists to be announced in the coming weeks. This year signals the return of International Jazz Day to the U.S. after 10 years. It was last held stateside in 2016 at the White House with hosts President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama, a Chicago native. International Jazz Day 2025 took place in Abu Dhabi. In a press statement, jazz icon Herbie Hancock said, â€œI’m excited that Chicago, my hometown, is â€¦

title: Bad Bunnyâ€™s â€˜TitÃ­ Me PreguntÃ³â€™ Surpasses 1 Billion ViewsÂ onÂ YouTube
summary: This is the Puerto Rican star's 19th video to enter the Billion Views Club.
body: Yet another Bad Bunny music video has entered YouTubeâ€™s Billion Views Club with â€œTitÃ­ Me PreguntÃ³,â€ published on June 1, 2022, surpassing the one billion mark. This becomes the Puerto Rican artistâ€™s 19th music video as a lead, featured artist or collaborator. He also rises to No. 3 on the weekly US Top Artists YouTube chart.  A track off his blockbuster Un Verano Sin TÃ­ album, the dembow-heavy banger peaked at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart in Oct. 15, 2022 and spent 14 weeks atop. In the music video, filmed by his longtime director Stillz in New York City, Bad Bunny perfectly captures the songâ€™s â€œYOLOâ€ sentiment, bringing to life its lyrics about a person who likes to date around and doesnâ€™t want to settle down.  It starts off with a boy being rejected by the girl he likes, then shows him enjoying the single life, and hooking up with girls, all before he gets kidnapped and forced to marry. In honor of the artistâ€™s first all-out dembow track, the video also pays homage to Dominican culture, showing scenes at a local barbershop and the bodega (corner neighborhood shop). â€œItâ€™s a song that was born very spontaneously,â€ Bad Bunny said back in 2023 . â€œAll of theâ€¦

title: Where to Get Lily Allen 2026 â€˜West End Girlâ€™ North America Tour Tickets Before Theyâ€™re Gone forÂ Good
summary: The British singer's tour tickets are selling fast due to the hype of her new album.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. At long last, Lily Allen is back, and this time, she’s going on a North American tour. It took almost seven years, but the English singer-songwriter made her return to music in a big way with her 2025 release of West End Girl via BMG, a scathing full-length triumph that serves as an autobiographical account of her marriage’s breakdown, particularly her relationship with actor David Harbour, best known for his work in the popular series Stranger Things . The last time Allen dropped an album was 2018 with No Shame featuring “Family Man,” “Come On Then” and “Apples.” View this post on Instagram The album deals with topics like heartbreak, infidelity, open relationship struggles and the emotional fallout of her marriage to Harbour in late 2024/early 2025 after four years of marriage, following months of speculation sparked by Allen, who was seen publicly without her wedding ring numerous times. The accompaâ€¦

title: NASA AI Model That Found 370 Exoplanets Now Digs Into TESS Data
summary: Trained on data from NASAâ€™s exoplanet-hunting missions, the open-source ExoMiner++ deep learning model uses an advanced algorithm to validate new planets.
body: 4 min read NASA AI Model That Found 370 Exoplanets Now Digs Into TESS Data This artistâ€™s impression shows the star TRAPPIST-1 with two planets transiting across it. ExoMiner++, a recently updated open-source software package developed by NASA, uses artificial intelligence to help find new transiting exoplanets in data collected by NASAâ€™s missions. NASA, ESA, and G. Bacon (STScI) Scientists have discovered over 6,000 planets that orbit stars other than our Sun, known as exoplanets. More than half of these planets were discovered thanks to data from NASAâ€™s retired Kepler mission and NASAâ€™s current TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) mission. However, the enormous treasure trove of data from these missions still contains many yet-to-be-discovered planets. All of the data from both missions is publicly available in NASA archives, and many teams around the world have used that data to find new planets using a number of techniques. In 2021, a team from NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center in Californiaâ€™s Silicon Valley created ExoMiner, a piece of open-source software that used artificial intelligence (AI) to validate 370 new exoplanets from Kepler data. The 3-foot-tall scale model is designed to increase a phenomenon known as laminar flow and reduce drag, improving efficiency in large, swept wings like those found on most commercial aircraft. The 3-foot-tall scale model looks like a fin mounted under the belly of one of the agencyâ€™s research F-15B testbed jets. body: NASA/Sam Lott This Jan. 17, 2026, image shows NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) and Orion spacecraft rolling out of the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. NASA’s massive Crawler-Transporter , upgraded for the Artemis program, carries the powerful SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft to Launch Pad 39B in preparation for the Artemis II mission. Moving at a maximum speed of just 0.82 mph, the crawler carried the towering Moon rocket and spacecraft slowly but surely toward the pad, reaching its destination at 6:42 p.m. EST after a nearly 12-hour journey. The Artemis II test flight will send NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, and Christina Koch, and CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen on an approximately 10-day journey around the Moon and back. It is another step toward new U.S.-crewed missions to the Moonâ€™s surface, leading to a sustained presence on the Moon that will help the agency prepare to send the first astronauts â€“ Americans â€“ to Mars.
